info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR REDUCED VISIBILITIES FROM SNOWFALL THIS AFTERNOON... WEATHER... * Additional snow showers are impacting portions of Southeast Michigan this afternoon. * Isolated additional snow accumulations of up to one half inch are possible. * Air temperatures range between 32 and 36 degrees limiting roadway accumulations. * Northwest winds around 15 mph with gusts to 20 mph. IMPACTS... * Snowfall will cause reductions of visibility to less than one half mile at times. There may also be rapid fluctuations of visibility. * Expect some slick spots, particularly on bridges, exit ramps, and overpasses. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * The combination of snow and near-freezing temperatures will result in localized slippery conditions and variable traffic rates, mainly due to reduced visibility. Motorists are urged to use caution and allow extra travel time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
